intro: Maieta leucandra, commonly known as white mayweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its white petals and yellow disk flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn. Maieta leucandra is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
